attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 4th Edition
text: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something; a trial:  a test of one's eyesight; subjecting a hypothesis to a test; a test of an athlete's endurance.

attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 4th Edition
text: A series of questions, problems, or physical responses designed to determine knowledge, intelligence, or ability.

attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 4th Edition
text: A basis for evaluation or judgment: "A test of democratic government is how Congress and the president work together”  ( Haynes Johnson).

attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 4th Edition
text: Chemistry   A physical or chemical change by which a substance may be detected or its properties ascertained.

attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 4th Edition
text: Chemistry   A reagent used to cause or promote such a change.

attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 4th Edition
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 4th Edition
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 4th Edition
text: To subject to a test; try:  tested the pen by scribbling on scrap paper; testing job applicants.

attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 4th Edition
text: To determine the presence or properties of (a substance).

attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 4th Edition
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 4th Edition
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 4th Edition
text: To administer a test:  test for acid content; test for the presence of an antibody.

attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 4th Edition
text: To achieve a score or rating on tests:  tested high on the entrance exams.

attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 4th Edition
text: To exhibit a given characteristic when subjected to a test:  test positive for the tubercle bacillus.

attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 4th Edition
text: A hard external covering, as that of certain amoebas, dinoflagellates, and sea urchins.
